content.title: Pulmonary Arteriovenous Malformations in HHT
content.definition: Abnormal direct connections between pulmonary arteries and veins occurring in patients with hereditary hemorrhagic telangiectasia, causing right-to-left shunting with risk of hypoxemia and paradoxical embolism.

concepts.definition: Occurrence of pulmonary AVMs in HHT patients.

clinical_features.hht_type: More common in HHT1 (ENG mutation) than HHT2

clinical_features.paradoxical_embolism: Stroke, brain abscess from systemic embolization

concepts.definition: Detection of pulmonary AVMs in HHT.

clinical_features.interpretation: Late bubbles (3-8 cardiac cycles) suggest pulmonary AVM
clinical_features.ct: CT chest if bubble echo positive to characterize AVMs
clinical_features.frequency: Screen at diagnosis, repeat every 5-10 years

clinical_features.embolization: Transcatheter embolization with coils or plugs
clinical_features.follow_up: CT follow-up to assess for reperfusion, new AVMs

clinical_features.key_point: All HHT patients should be screened for pulmonary AVMs
clinical_features.pregnancy: Higher risk during pregnancy - screen/treat before

sources.reference: Defined Defined Defined Defined Ann Intern Med. 2020;173:989-1001
